title: Pittville Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Part of Pittville Park and a bandstand, Cheltenham
images.caption: Part of Pittville Park and a bandstand, Cheltenham. This attractive circular building has a tiled roof. Others I have seen tend to have lead or zinc roofs. It is situated just west of the terrace in front of the southern elevation of Pittville Pump Room. The park can be seen behind.

images.title: Anthony O'Neil / Pittville Pump Room and Marquee, Cheltenham
images.caption: Pittville Pump Room and Marquee, Cheltenham. This is one of the key venues for the annual International Music Festival where recitals of classical music (new and old) take place and are often recorded by the BBC. Morning coffee and lunches are served in the marquee for audience and artists. The park contains many fine specimen trees and a lake

images.title: Play area in Pittville Park by Terry Jacombs, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Play area

images.title: Reading Tom from Reading, UK, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Scenic Bridge and Lake. Designed by John Forbes and completed c. 1830-40.

description: Enjoy a short waterside walk or cycle around this pretty park in Cheltenham . In the park you will find aviaries , small areas of woodland and three lakes with waterside paths. You will also pass the impressive Grade I listed Pittville Pump Room. Built in 1825 it is the last and largest of the spa buildings to be built in Cheltenham. There are also play areas for children, a boat house and cafe. Cyclists can cycle around the two western lakes so it's a nice option for anyone looking for a safe family ride in the town.
